Key Match Events: Nick Castellanos hit a walk-off single to left field to score Trea Turner and win Game 2 of the NLDS against the Mets
Post-Match Reflections: Phillies manager Rob Thomson praised Castellanos' ability to perform under pressure and his crucial hits throughout the season
Players and teammates celebrated Castellanos' walk-off hit, highlighting its significance
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series was tied 2-2, and the home team's historical 89% win rate in such situations was noted
Castellanos' five walk-off hits tied for the third-most in a single season since 1974
